messages.message:
<!here> Anyone who builds webapp locally for development from master and is hitting 404 errors everywhere, if you run webapp with this flag: `make build runlocal LEGACY=true`  everything should be back to it’s previous state. (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/12427) @dlluncor was this the intended behaviour? Should we keep LEGACY=true as the default for now until we fix it for false?

EDIT: Let’s not use the LEGACY=true flag! Everyone should run server-nginx.
@Heymian would you be willing to look at this with me? I wonder if this is because of the work around not needing the proxy. :slightly_smiling_face:
yup sure thing. haha i only spent like two min on this, but i think it’s most definitely related to the proxy. GET requests are going through, none of the other ones are.
Heymian and I found it! It is related to the changes @dlluncor and I worked on with the proxy. I didn’t understand the full context on what was happening earlier. :slightly_smiling_face:
The fix is to run the `server-nginx` service with `make build-docker run-docker-proxy` and then use/develop on instabase via http://localhost
If you use chrome there is a comment in the make target for how to allow chrome to connect via https://localhost
The fix is in this thread. but to recap: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1580151898140400?thread_ts=1580150135.138500&cid=C06FA6A23
Do you want to also update our onboarding docs (if you haven’t already)
I’d be glad to update the onboarding docs. Do we need it anywhere other than front end development on 2. Setting up your dev environment?
Oh I see. David did update it, I think we can just fix some of the language around it
I rearranged it and adjusted the verbiage. Not sure if `RELOAD=true` is impacted as well?
@will is the nginx docker image cached in scan-py3?
